description.narrative:
Insatsen är ett stöd till Moçambiques statistikmyndighet INE och dess produktion av befolknings-, social, jämställdhets- och ekonomisk statistik. Under 2017 genomfördes en folkräkning där det nu finns en stor mängd data att behandla under 2018 och 2019. Särskilt fokus kommer därför att vara på folkräkningsrelaterade aktiviteter.
Bidraget går via UNFPAs statistikfond (Trust Fund) under åren 2018-2019 och har som mål att såväl offentlig som privat sektorn, civilsamhället och media ska ha tillgång till och kunna använda sig av tillförlitlig och konsistent, uppdaterad statistik och -analys. Med detta förväntas Moçambique få bättre möjligheter för statlig(t) planering och genomförande, stärkt ansvarsutkrävande, politiska beslut fattade på sakliga grunder samt en förbättrad uppföljning av utvecklingen i landet.
Detta ska åstadkommas genom 1) institutionell kapacitetsuppbyggnad kring statistisk kvalitet i datainsamling och analys; 2) stärkande av regionala statistikkontor (INE:s provinsavdelningar) och deras kapacitet att planera, samla in och generera relevant och tillförlitlig befolkningsstatistik; och 3) stärkt förmåga på INE att kommunicera och nå ut till allmänheten kring statistik, samt att också bättre fånga upp och nå utsatta eller underrepresenterade grupper i samhället i sin datainsamling (framför allt kvinnor och flickor, samt människor som lever med funktionshinder).

The contribution is a support to the statistical agency INE and its production of population, social, gender and economic statistics. During 2017 a population and housing census was conducted with a massive data set to process during 2018 and 2019. Specific focus is therefore on the activities related to the census. The support is channelled through UNFPAs Statistics Trust Fund. It aims to give the public and private sectors as well as civil society and media access to and use reliable and consistent population data and analysis.
Three outputs are designed to work in support of the outcome: Output 1: Human and institutional capacity strengthened ensuring quality collection and data analysis. Output 2: Increased capabilities of national and provincial agencies to plan, prepare and generate quality population census data on households, women and men. Output 3: Strengthened communication, confidence building and data culture promoting an inclusive census (specifically for girls and women, and for persons living with disabilities).

The Swedish support to the Mozambique statistics system through the UNFPA Trust Fund is aiming to give the government, public and private sectors, civil society and others access to reliable, updated and consistent demographic, social and economic statistics. Outcome: By making accurate data accessible for all it is expected that there will be improved planning and use of public resources, fact-based political decisions and in general an increased transparency and access to information. Impact: With published data in 2018 and 2019 the 2017 Population Census is expected to be a catalyst to further a wider policy agenda related to creating a stronger data based policy culture. Outcomes/activities: 1) strengthening human and institutional resources ensuring quality collection and data analysis; 2) increasing the capabilities of national agencies to plan, prepare and generate quality population census data; and 3) strengthening communication, confidence building and data culture promoting an inclusive census. Specific focus on capturing data on living conditions for women and girls, and for persons living with disabilities will help gathering more information on vulnerability and exclusion.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution UNFPA Statistics Trust Fund

description.narrative: In 2019, data processing operations continued and were successfully completed with technical and operational support provided by the Trust Fund. The official results of the 2017 census were launched on 29 April 2019, an important milestone for the project and of course also for Mozambique. The publishing of the census data marked the entry of the program into the dissemination phase, which is a major focus for 2019 and 2020. Provincial-level tabulations, including demographic data for the districts, were published in July 2019. 2,226 people received capacity in statistics literacy. Of these, 68% (1,520) were secondary school students and the remaining 32% (706) were from Government Administration at Provincial and District levels. The overall outreach represents 84% of the target for the year. Activities were undertaken throughout the country covering all provinces and 28 Districts. The Provincial and District Administration staff are testifying of the difference the training has made in their daily work. Major steps forward can be noted when it comes to gender statistics. Capacity development has been in focus for the new Gender Statistics Unit at INE, as well as for other statistical units at INE. This has led to an increased knowledge of how to produce statistics on gender. Swedish and Canadian support has specifically requested this component. 10 technicians from the cartography department were trained in census data geo-referencing. Using maps for displaying data to the public is considered an important tool for making statistics more user friendly. Despite the delays in Census dissemination, the Mozambique Government is now using the 2017 Census results in the planning of 2020 – 24 Development Plan. Substantial progress was also achieved on results related to institutional and human capacity building planned for this year such as Gender statistics, Statistics Literacy, Territorial Statistics and GIS.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
